titleStmt.title: The ninth part of the Mirrour of knight-hood eing the fourth booke of the third part thereof: wherein is declared, the high and noble actes of the sonnes and nephewes of the noble Emperour Trebacius, and of the rest of the renoumed princes and knights, and of the high cheualrie of the gallant ladyes: wherein also is treated of the most cruell warre that euer was in Greece, with the amorous euents, and the end thereof.
Espejo de principes y cavalleros. Part 4. Book 2. English.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed [by Simon Stafford] for Cuthbert Burbie, and are to be sold at his shop, at the Royall Exchange,

notesStmt.note: In fact a translation of book 2 of part 4 of "Espejo de principes y cavalleros", written by Marcos Martínez. There are a total of four parts written by various authors.
The translation is sometimes attributed to Robert Parry or to Robert Parke.
Running title reads: The fourth booke of the third part of the Mirrour of knighthood.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
